intro: Citrullus ecirrhosus, commonly known as the horned cucumber, is a unique species of flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive horn-like projections on the fruit, which are more pronounced in mature specimens. The plant produces bright yellow flowers and has a trailing growth habit, often found in warm, arid environments. Its fruit is typically elongated and can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The botanical features of Citrullus ecirrhosus make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
